main event: A blue-white, oblong object was observed 3 miles west of St. Albans, West Virginia on March 15, 1961.
interesting points: The object was approximately 100 feet in length and appeared 3 miles above sea level., The object maneuvered erratically and passed directly over the observer., The sighting lasted for 415 seconds., The object disappeared after moving off., Comments suggest it could have been a meteorological phenomenon burning up in the atmosphere.
witness description: individual who observed the object from the ground
